title: Eosinophilic Fasciitis: Epidemiological Overview
short_description: Clinical document describing the demographic characteristics and epidemiology of eosinophilic fasciitis, a rare connective tissue disorder.
long_description: This clinical research document provides an epidemiological overview of eosinophilic fasciitis, detailing the demographic patterns of this rare connective tissue disorder. The document covers gender distribution (with possible female predominance), age demographics (primarily affecting adults aged 30-60 years, though cases range from 1-88 years), racial predisposition (higher frequency in Caucasians), and disease prevalence (approximately 300 reported cases in medical literature). This information serves as foundational epidemiological data for understanding the population characteristics and rarity of eosinophilic fasciitis.
